author: Chris Strohm, Chris Dolmetsch
description: The Trump administration asked a federal court to unseal grand jury transcripts related to the case of late, disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein following a torrent of criticism that government officials were hiding documents and information.
title: DOJ Asks Judge to Unseal Epstein Grand Jury Transcripts

author: Tony Aarons
description: The Trump administration asked a federal court to unseal grand jury transcripts related to late, disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein following a torrent of criticism that government officials were hiding documents and information.
title: US Files to Unseal Epstein Grand Jury Transcripts

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A federal judge in Manhattan has dismissed a lawsuit brought by President Donald Trump against journalist Bob Woodward and a publishing house over the release of interview recordings from his first term in office.
title: Judge Tosses Trump Suit Over Bob Woodward’s Recordings for Now

author: Akayla Gardner
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: MAGA Fury Over Epstein Files Opens Rare Fracture With Trump

author: Nick Wadhams, Ryan Chua
description: The top US intelligence official declassified an email trove purporting to expose a Democratic conspiracy to cast doubt on Donald Trump’s 2016 election win, just as his team seeks to defuse criticism over its handling of files linked to financier Jeffrey Epstein.
title: Gabbard Alleges Democratic ‘Conspiracy’ in 2016 Election

author: Sri Taylor
description: The Trump administration is canceling $327 million in federal aid to Massachusetts that had been awarded to partially finance a nearly $2 billion rebuild of a notoriously congested portion of the Massachusetts turnpike in Boston.
title: Trump to Terminate $327 Million in Massachusetts Transit Funds

author: Stephanie Lai, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump signed the first federal bill to regulate stablecoins, hailing it as a “giant step to cement American dominance of global finance and crypto technology” and delivering a major victory for the digital asset industry.
title: Trump Signs Stablecoin Bill, Delivering Win for Crypto Industry

author: Nathan Risser
description: California Governor Gavin Newsom is proposing a bill to streamline permitting for new oil wells that environmental groups say would wipe out scrutiny of the industry.
title: Newsom Proposes to Ease Permits for Oil Drilling in California

author: Myles Miller, Alicia A. Caldwell, Courtney McBride
description: The Trump administration will temporarily house migrants at military bases in New Jersey and Indiana, according to a letter sent to Congress, deepening the Pentagon’s role in a historic expansion of immigration enforcement.
title: New Jersey Base Set to House Migrant Detainees, Pentagon Says

author: Kevin Orland
description: Canada’s top oil-producing province of Alberta is injecting C$2.8 billion ($2 billion) into its provincial wealth fund, advancing a plan to wean itself off volatile resource revenue in the decades ahead.
title: Alberta Invests $2 Billion Into Wealth Fund to Speed Growth Plan

author: Amanda Albright, Myles Miller
description: The University of Chicago has received information requests from the US Department of Justice and the Department of Homeland Security concerning admissions practices and international students.
title: University of Chicago Faces DOJ Query on International Students

author: Jamie Tarabay
description: The US Senate is considering giving up crucial authority over key intelligence officials responsible for assuring major agencies comply with legal restrictions and the Constitution.
title: Senate Considers Ending Its Vetting of Spy Agencies’ Top Lawyers

author: Joe Deaux, Jenny Leonard, Alicia Diaz, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump is readying plans for industry-specific tariffs to kick in alongside his country-by-country duties in two weeks, ramping up his push to reshape the US’s standing in the global trading system by penalizing purchases from abroad.
title: Trump Aims Tariff Double Whammy at Industries, Nations by Aug. 1

author: Olesia Safronova
description: Ukraine’s government has no plans to raise tariffs for the country’s largest state-run transport company Ukrzaliznitsya this year, aiming to avoid additional costs for producers that rely on the rail network, Deputy Premier and Regional Development Minister Oleksiy Kuleba said.
title: Kyiv Has No Plan to Hike Railroad Tariffs This Year, Kuleba Says

author: Patrick Gillespie, Manuela Tobias, Bob Van Voris
description: Argentina won’t negotiate with Burford Capital, the firm leading efforts to collect a $16 billion judgment against the South American nation, a spokesman for President Javier Milei told reporters Friday.
title: Argentina Says It Won’t Negotiate With Burford Over YPF Shares

author: Carolina Gonzalez
description: Chile’s congress is debating a bill that would exempt foreign residents from paying a fine if they fail to vote in November’s presidential election, unlike Chileans. The opposition is crying foul.
title: Chile Grapples With Impact of Anti-Left Immigrant Voters

author: Alberto Nardelli, Andrea Palasciano, Ellen Milligan
description: The UK joined the European Union’s efforts to diminish Russia’s revenues further by lowering the price cap on its crude oil, extending a broader push to pressure the Kremlin for continuing the war in Ukraine.
title: UK Joins EU Push to Hit Russia by Cutting Crude-Oil Price Cap

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: An internal Republican fight over a drive to prevent the US government from issuing a crypto “digital dollar” ground activity in the House to a halt this week as the party’s right flank fought to ensure the ban would become law.
title: Right-Wing Revolt Over Crypto Signals Angst Over Digital Dollar

author: Georgina Boos, Mark Niquette
description: The federal government workforce in and around the nation’s capital has shrunk by about 22,100 in the year through May, a new report shows, and that number is poised to mount.
title: Federal Workforce in DC Area Has Shrunk by About 22,000 People

author: Andreina Itriago
description: Venezuela is set to receive a group of deportees freed from jail in El Salvador following an unexpected breakthrough in ongoing talks with the US.
title: Maduro to Receive Venezuela Deportees Jailed in El Salvador

author: Mackenzie Hawkins, Alicia Diaz, Ian King
description: The Trump administration’s decision allowing Nvidia Corp. to resume shipments of its H20 artificial intelligence chips to China risks bolstering Beijing’s military capabilities and expanding its capacity to compete with the US in AI, according to the head of the US House Select Committee on China.
title: House China Panel Faults Trump’s Move to Ease Nvidia AI Chip Sales

author: Laura Nahmias
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams said the Trump administration should release the documents related to disgraced financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, who killed himself in a federal prison in 2019.
title: NYC Mayor Adams Talks Epstein Files, Billionaires and Mamdani

author: Ellen Milligan, Michael Nienaber
description: The UK is looking to participate in European purchases of US military equipment for Ukraine, as allies seize on Donald Trump’s more hostile stance toward Russia even if it means financing the weapons themselves.
title: UK Looking to Join Trump Plan to Purchase US Weapons for Ukraine

author: Faseeh Mangi
description: Pakistan’s Finance Minister Muhammad Aurangzeb is in the US to negotiate Washington’s demands as part of trade talks ahead of an August deadline, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Pakistan’s Finance Minister in US to Push for Trade Deal

author: Nicola M White
description: US Securities and Exchange Commission Chairman Paul Atkins says the agency will work closely with its counterparts at the Labor Department when considering potential changes to rules for retirement plans.
title: SEC’s Atkins Says Changes to 401(k) Plans Must Be Reviewed Carefully

author: Sabrina Nelson Garcinuno
description: Barcelona is set to reduce the number of port terminals for cruise ships in the city’s latest attempt to limit the number of tourist visits.
title: Barcelona to Limit Cruise Ship Visits by Reducing Port Capacity

author: Paul Wallace
description: The Group of 20 finance ministers and central bank chiefs committed themselves to international policy cooperation in a communique adopted on Friday, finding rare consensus amid escalating tensions over the US trade war.
title: G-20 Pledges to Boost Cooperation as It Seals Communique

author: Matthew Hill, Jennifer Zabasajja, Ben Bartenstein
description: South Africa is edging closer to leaving a global financial watchdog’s so-called gray list in October, with a team of assessors scheduled to visit the nation this month.
title: South Africa Moves Closer to Exiting Dirty-Money List in October

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro will be required to wear an electronic ankle monitor after police carried out search warrants against him on Friday, local press reported.
title: Bolsonaro Is Ordered to Wear Ankle Monitor, Brazil Press Says

author: Alex Wickham
description: The UK government sanctioned 18 people it named as spies from Russia’s GRU military intelligence agency who it said were responsible for conducting cyber and hybrid warfare operations against Britain and Ukraine.
title: UK Sanctions Russian Spies Over Cyber Warfare Operations

author: Melos Ambaye
description: While authorities were desperately trying to save people from the deadly Fourth of July floods in Kerr County, Texas, a private drone collided with a search and rescue helicopter and forced it to make an emergency landing, one of the latest incidents in a trend of uncrewed aerial vehicles flying into restricted zones.
title: Drone Crashes, Security Threats Have States Demanding Power to Take Them Down

author: Anisah Shukry
description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said his government will give “due consideration” to President Donald Trump’s pick as ambassador, seeking to balance relations with Washington and domestic ire over some of the potential envoy’s political commentary.
title: Trump’s Controversial Pick for Malaysia Envoy to Get Anwar’s ‘Due Consideration’

author: Arne Delfs, Michael Nienaber
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz reiterated his opposition to UniCredit SpA’s bid to take over Commerzbank AG, criticizing the Italian lender’s “unfriendly approach” and warning a combination could carry financial risks.
title: Merz Warns of Financial Risks From UniCredit-Commerzbank Tie-Up

author: Sakura Murakami
description: The prime minister has a lot riding on this weekend’s upper house elections.
title: Japan Is Facing Extended Turbulence With or Without Ishiba

author: Andrea Palasciano, Max Ramsay, Michal Kubala
description: European Union member states approved the launch of negotiations with six Gulf countries as the bloc seeks to broaden its international partnerships amid tariff threats from President Donald Trump.
title: EU Agrees to Start Talks With Gulf Nations on Strategic Ties

author: Michael Nienaber, Arne Delfs
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz vowed to put a choppy start to his tenure behind him and focus on returning Europe’s biggest economy to meaningful growth.
title: Merz Vows to Focus on Boosting Economy After Bumpy Start in Job

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Interference in the independence of the Federal Reserve would be felt outside of the US, according to Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel.
title: Challenges to Fed Independence Resonate Beyond US, Nagel Says

author: Shruti Srivastava
description: India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi is likely to visit the UK next week to sign the recent trade deal between the two countries, a government official told reporters in New Delhi.
title: India’s Modi Likely to Visit UK Next Week to Sign Trade Deal

author: Michael Heath
description: Australia is evaluating the impact of potential US tariffs of 200% on pharmaceutical imports, Treasurer Jim Chalmers said, while reiterating that his nation’s subsidies for certain drugs are not up for negotiation.
title: Australia’s Treasurer Weighs Impact of Possible US Drug Tariff

author: Gresa Kraja
description: Authorities want to tear down structures built without permission during the mayhem that followed the collapse of communism in 1991.
title: Kiosks, Beach Shacks and Alpine Cabins: Albania Goes After Illegal Builds

author: Alberto Nardelli, Andrea Palasciano
description: European Union states have approved a fresh sanctions package on Russia over its war against Ukraine including a revised oil price cap, new banking restrictions, and curbs on fuels made from Russian petroleum.
title: EU Imposes New Raft of Sanctions on Russia and Its Oil Trade

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon, Ditas B Lopez
description: The Philippines hopes to secure a trade agreement with the US when President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. discusses a planned US tariff during his meeting with President Donald Trump in Washington, according to a Manila official.
title: Philippines Eyes US Trade Deal as Marcos Set to Meet Trump

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: The US has designated The Resistance Front, which initially claimed responsibility for the deadly attacks in Kashmir, as a terrorist organization, marking a diplomatic victory for India.
title: US Declares Group Accused of Kashmir Attacks a Terror Outfit

author: Erik Wasson
description: A half century of US federal funding for public television and radio came crashing to an end as the House approved a $9 billion package of spending cuts inspired by Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency task force.
title: House Strips PBS, NPR of Funds as Trump Vows More DOGE Bills

author: Timothy McLaughlin
description: The Kachin Independence Organization fought for decades in obscurity. Now it’s supplying essential minerals to manufacturers around the world.
title: A Rebel Army Is Building a Rare-Earth Empire on China’s Border

author: Jana Randow, Harumi Ichikura
description: The European Central Bank can delay its final interest-rate cut until December without investors concluding in the meantime that easing is over, a Bloomberg survey of economists showed.
title: ECB May Wait Until December to Make Final Rate Cut, Survey Shows

author: Oma Seddiq, Stephanie Lai
description: President Donald Trump is expected to announce policy guidelines for artificial intelligence that will call for easing regulation and expanding energy sources for data centers, while urging Congress to consider federal legislation to preempt state oversight of the emerging technology.
title: Trump AI Guidelines Expected to Loosen Rules, Pursue Energy

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: North Korea has suspended foreigners’ access to a newly opened beach resort on its east coast, just days after Russia’s top diplomat visited the area and vowed to help increase tourist flows to the isolated country.
title: North Korea Bans Foreigners From Beach Resort After Lavrov Trip

author: Sergio Mendoza
description: Bolivia’s richest man, Marcelo Claure, plans to support center-right candidate Samuel Doria Medina in the upcoming presidential elections, in an attempt to unseat the left.
title: Bolivia’s Richest Man Backs a Millionaire Candidate in Bid to Oust the Left

author: Jordan Fabian
description: US President Donald Trump directed the Justice Department to seek the release of grand jury testimony related to Jeffrey Epstein, bowing to mounting pressure from his own supporters for more transparency about the late, disgraced financier.
title: Trump Seeks Release of Grand Jury Documents in Epstein Case

author: Anup Roy
description: A senior Indian statistician is urging greater data-sharing with the federal government, including access to mobile payments and official records, to improve the accuracy and reliability of key economic indicators.
title: Indian Government Needs More Data Access, Says Key Statistician

author: Josh Xiao
description: China’s spy agency has accused overseas intelligence agencies of stealing controlled rare earth materials, reiterating its intent to curb smuggling even as Beijing agrees to review applications to export the vital industrial resource after trade talks with the US.
title: China Spy Agency Accuses Foreign Agents of Stealing Rare Earths

author: Anuradha Raghu, Ram Anand
description: Malaysia appointed Court of Appeal judge Wan Ahmad Farid Wan Salleh as the new chief justice of the Federal Court, ending a two-week vacancy that had sparked concerns over the independence of the judiciary.
title: Malaysia Names New Top Judge, Ending Prolonged Vacancy
